page.title: 18THE CLOCKHOUSE:UPMINSTER
page.content: The building and grounds of the historic clockhouse stands facing the main road near Upminster town centre. {Throughout its history it has {reflected the changing character of {the area around it. The clockhouse was originally built in 1775 as a coach house for a{country {manor}called New Place. In 1924 New Place Manor was demolished and the Clockhouse was taken by{Hornchurch Urban District {Council as a Public library.}The building was old and decay set in.It was in fact infested by beetles and so all the books were transferred to the present library in Corbets Tey Rd. Now the clockhouse is used as a number of{flats}although the grounds behind it have been made into an attractive park complete with a moat on which the Manor once stood.
